name: 1000 Voices and Genesis Centre
description: A gathering place offering community meetings, programs, cultural arts, and events. Provides workplace programs and career counselling.

name: ActionDignity
description: Facilitates the collective voice of Calgary’s ethno-cultural communities towards full civic participation and integration through collaborative action. Offers various youth programs for newcomers and immigrants.

name: Agapé Language Centre
description: Offers Adult ESL and the Government LINC (Language Instruction for Newcomers to Canada) program with online classes available.

name: Bow Valley College
description: Provides programs and courses in English Language Learning and Immigrant Advancement to help newcomers gain skills for living, studying, and working in Canada.

name: Calgary Board of Education
description: Calgary’s public school system. Assists non-Canadian citizen children with school registration and offers interpretation and translation support.

name: The Calgary Bridge Foundation for Youth
description: Provides services for immigrant and refugee youth and their families, including settlement assistance, information on community resources, and culturally sensitive services in over 30 languages.

name: Calgary Catholic Immigration Society
description: Offers settlement and integration services to newcomers and refugees, including employment assistance, language training, skills training, and advocacy through a multilingual team.

name: Calgary Catholic School District
description: Provides separate school registration for newcomers and offers support to immigrant youth and their families in adjusting to the Canadian school system.

name: Calgary Immigrant Women’s Association
description: Focuses on the needs of immigrant and refugee women, girls, and their families, offering settlement and integration services, language training, and employment support.

name: Calgary Public Library
description: Offers various library services, including special workshops and programs for newcomers, ESL resources, online courses, and community connections.

name: Calgary Region Immigrant Employment Council
description: Connects newcomer professionals to strategies leading to successful employment outcomes.

name: Centre D’Accueil Pour Les Nouveaux Arrivants Francophones
description: Supports Francophone newcomers in their integration and social and professional adaptation.

name: Centre for Newcomers
description: Provides settlement and integration services, including needs assessment, orientation to life in Canada, and referrals to programs for language, employment, and more.

name: Maple Leaf Academy
description: An English as a Second Language school offering full-time, part-time evening, and Saturday classes, including IRCC-funded programs for Permanent Residents or Refugees.

name: YWCA Calgary (SE)
description: Offers language, employment, and settlement training for newcomers and low-income families, including guidance on accessing various community services.

name: YMCA Calgary (SW)
description: Provides English language classes for newcomers, focusing on improving communication skills and offering various part-time classes during the day and evenings.
